euclidext

Class EuclidsExtended

  • java.lang.Object
    • euclidext.EuclidsExtended

  • public class EuclidsExtended
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of Euclid's Extend Algortihm for finding the GCD. This class is used to find A*M+B*N=D for any input M and N where B is the greatest common denominator. To use this class, instantiate an object of type EuclidsExtended supplying input1 and input2. The constructor sets up the class to run. To run the algorithm call .execute() on the object. To retrieve the results call .getResult().

    • Constructor Detail

      • EuclidsExtended

        public EuclidsExtended(int input1,
               int input2)
        Instantiate the class. The result will be of the form A*M+B*N=D. Input1 corresponds to M and input2 corresponds to N.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public boolean execute()
        This function runs the actual algorithm on the input supplied in the constructor.

      • getCoeff1

        public int getCoeff1()
        Get the coefficient for input1. This is used in constructing the form A*M+B*N=D where A is this returned coefficent and M is input1. Call this function after calling execute()

      • getCoeff2

        public int getCoeff2()
        Get the coefficient for input2. This is used in constructing the form A*M+B*N=D where B is this returned coefficent and N is input1. Call this function after calling execute()

      • getGCD

        public int getGCD()
        Get the greatest common denominator. This is used in constructing the form A*M+B*N=D where D is this returned value. The greatest common denominator is the largest number which evenly devides input1 (M) and input2 (N). Call this function after calling execute()

      • getResult

        public Result getResult()
        Get a datastructure containing the result of the algorithm. Call this function after calling execute()
